principles.name: Neckline Effects on Body Perception
principles.mechanism: Neckline type and depth control perceived neck length, shoulder width, bust framing, and upper body volume. Each neckline creates a specific geometric interaction with the body.

key_effects.v_neck: Elongation via Muller-Lyer wings-out. Depth determines perceived extension. Dividing threshold by bust size.
key_effects.crew_neck: Shortens perceived neck by ~1.0 inch. Creates horizontal line across upper chest.
key_effects.boat_neck: Widens perceived shoulder width by 1.5-3.0 inches. Horizontal emphasis.
key_effects.square_neck: Angularizes face shape perception. Creates structured frame.
key_effects.turtleneck: Shortens perceived neck by ~2.0 inches. Creates monolithic column effect. REVERSAL for long necks.
key_effects.sweetheart: Bust illusion via curved neckline framing. Enhances perceived bust by 0.5-1.0 cup size.
key_effects.cowl_neck: Adds volume at upper chest. Drape creates visual mass.
key_effects.off_shoulder: Exposes shoulder-to-arm transition. Effect depends on shoulder width relative to body.
key_effects.wrap_surplice: COMPOUND mechanism: V-elongation + diagonal slimming + waist definition + bust accommodation

principles.name: Sleeve Effects on Arm and Shoulder Perception
principles.mechanism: Sleeve termination point determines perceived arm width. Arm appears as wide as where it's last visible. The TRANSLATION PROBLEM: same sleeve length creates different effects on different arm lengths.

key_effects.cap_sleeve: Creates 'ledge' effect at widest upper arm. Widens perceived arm by framing at maximum circumference. Score: -0.30 to -0.60.
key_effects.three_quarter: Terminates at forearm narrowest point — OPTIMAL for arm slimming. Score: +0.75 to +1.00. BUT translation problem on petite/tall arms.
key_effects.puff_sleeve: Shoulder widening by 0.5-4.0 inches depending on volume. Peak use case: pear body. Extreme reversal: inverted triangle.
key_effects.flutter: Widens at shoulder but with movement/softness that reduces harshness vs cap sleeve.

principles.key_concept: Sleeve Frame Effect: termination at widest arm point (position 3 inches from shoulder) is worst; termination at forearm narrowest (3/4 length) is optimal.
principles.translation_problem: Standard '3/4 sleeve' at 17 inches from shoulder reaches WRIST on petite arms (<21 inches) and mid-forearm on tall arms (>25 inches).

principles.name: Hemline Effects on Leg Perception
principles.mechanism: Hemline position relative to anatomical landmarks determines perceived leg length. Three DANGER ZONES exist: widest thigh, kneecap, widest calf. Safe zone between knee and calf may COLLAPSE on petite bodies.

key_effects.above_knee: Elongation benefit: +0.20 per inch above knee (diminishing returns). Max +0.60.
key_effects.knee_danger: Bisects leg at joint. Score: -0.30 to -0.40.
key_effects.below_knee_safe: Zone between knee danger and calf danger. Score: +0.15 to +0.30 if zone exists.
key_effects.calf_danger: Frames leg at maximum lower-leg width. Score: -0.35 to -0.50.
key_effects.ankle: Frames at narrowest leg point. Score: +0.25 to +0.45.
key_effects.floor: Legs fully covered. Score: +0.05 to +0.15 (tall); -0.10 (petite without heels).

principles.translation_problem: A 'knee length' dress on a 5'9 model lands at mid-thigh on a 5'2 body. Garment length must be scaled by height ratio.
principles.zone_collapse: When knee-to-calf distance < 4.5 inches (petite), danger zones OVERLAP. No safe below-knee position exists.

principles.name: Waistline and Proportion Effects
principles.mechanism: Waist placement shifts perceived division between upper and lower body, directly controlling torso-to-leg ratio. Golden ratio target: visual legs = 61.8% of total visual height.

key_effects.empire: Under bust — raises visual waist. Elongates perceived legs. BUT: tent effect risk on large bust + stiff fabric. Shape loss on hourglass.
key_effects.high_waist: Between empire and natural. Good balance of elongation and waist definition.
key_effects.natural_waist: At anatomical waist. Maintains current proportions. Belt at natural waist on apple = HARMFUL.
key_effects.drop_waist: Below natural waist. Shortens perceived legs. Severe worsening on short legs.
key_effects.no_waist: Column without division point. Neutral score.

principles.name: Silhouette and Fit Effects
principles.mechanism: Silhouette controls which body zones are revealed vs. concealed, and creates engineered shapes that may differ from body shape.

key_effects.a_line: Skims hips without clinging. Good for pear. Creates triangle that balances wider shoulders on inverted triangle.
key_effects.bodycon: Reveals all contours. Positive on smooth contours, negative on irregular contours.
key_effects.fit_and_flare: Cinches waist + flares at hip. Flare origin point is critical — must be below true hip (at high hip) for pear.
key_effects.shift: Straight column. Minimal shaping. Good for rectangle (doesn't emphasize lack of curves). Bad for hourglass (hides curves).

principles.name: Color and Pattern Effects (Construction Context)
principles.mechanism: Dark color slimming (2-5% real, not 10-15% popular belief), horizontal stripe body-size dependency, skin-tone contrast, monochrome vs. color blocking. Shape-loss paradox: black erases waist definition on hourglass.

key_effects.dark_color: Near-black slims ~4% (L*<=10); dark ~3% (L*<=25); medium-dark ~2% (L*<=40); medium ~0.5%; light: mild widening.
key_effects.hourglass_black_paradox: Monochrome dark on hourglass ERASES waist definition. Net negative for strong hourglass (waist-hip diff >= 8 inches). Score: -0.30 at pure black.
key_effects.stripe_ashida: Body-size dependent: <30th percentile width H-stripes slim (+0.20); >70th percentile H-stripes widen (-0.18). Based on hip circumference proxy.
